headline: Is Textron (TXT) Quietly Resetting Its Risk‑Reward Profile With New Guidance, Buybacks and Board Shift?
summary: Textron Inc. recently reported fourth-quarter 2025 results showing revenue of US$4,175 million and net income of US$235 million, issued 2026 guidance, completed a US$2.44 billion share repurchase program, and announced the upcoming addition of Otis CFO Cristina Méndez to its board on February 15, 2026. By pairing heavier investment in its Bell MV-75 program and new defense work with the appointment of an audit-committee financial expert, Textron is sharpening both its capital deployment and...

headline: 5 Must-Read Analyst Questions From Textron’s Q4 Earnings Call
summary: Textron’s fourth quarter results drew a negative market reaction, despite the company topping Wall Street’s revenue and adjusted earnings expectations. Management attributed the quarter’s growth primarily to higher aircraft deliveries following recovery from the prior year’s strike, as well as expanded aftermarket activity and strong demand for Bell’s military helicopters. CEO Lisa Atherton also highlighted the impact of key certifications—such as the Citation Ascend and CJ3 Gen 2—on segment mom
